answers.A: A: The development of new plant species for space agriculture
answers.B: B: The analysis of microbial communities and food safety in crops grown on the ISS
answers.C: C: The engineering of advanced Veggie units for space stations
answers.D: D: The genetic modification of plants for better growth in space

summary: The study investigated microbial communities in plants grown on the ISS using both culturable and non-culturable methods, focusing on food safety and microbiome diversity. The VEG-03D technology demonstration successfully grew multiple plant species, and microbiological analysis confirmed the safety of the crops. The research revealed higher microbial diversity in roots and the rooting substrate compared to leaves, providing valuable insights for space agriculture.

answers.A: A: The effects of cosmic radiation on DNA damage and cellular function in space
answers.B: B: The development of personalized astronaut health protocols
answers.C: C: The analysis of sex-specific immune and endocrine responses to space radiation
answers.D: D: The assessment of physiological systems in astronauts during space missions

summary: This study assessed sex-specific, multi-system immune and endocrine responses to simulated cosmic radiation using male and female mice. The research found sexually dimorphic changes in adrenal gland morphology, RNA expression, and immune phenotypes after exposure to simulated galactic cosmic ray (GCRsim) radiation. These findings highlight the necessity for personalized health approaches for astronauts during exploration missions.
